intro: Amoora lanceolata, commonly known as the lanceleaf amboina, is a tropical tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in lowland rainforests and has a reputation for being a valuable source of timber. Its flowers, which are usually pink or white, attract various pollinators, including birds and insects. The tree is also noted for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal practices.
